column2: Dwarf]] of [[Nogrod]] in the [[Blue Mountains]], and one of the greatest smiths in the history of [[Middle-earth]].

column1: Telchar was trained by [[Gamil Zirak]], another great smith.<ref name="Narn">{{UT
column2: Narn}}, ''The Departure of Túrin''</ref>  Among his works were [[Angrist]] (the knife that freed the [[Silmarils
column4: Beren}}</ref> [[Narsil]] (the sword of [[Elendil]], later reforged for [[Aragorn]] as [[Andúril]]),<ref>{{TT
column5: III6}}</ref> and the [[Dragon-helm of Dor-lómin]].<ref name="Narn"/>

column1: It is not defined whether the name Telchar is [[Sindarin]] or [[Khuzdul]]. The formation seems to suggest to be Sindarin since the digraph ''ch'' is not used in Khuzdul.<ref>{{App
[[Jim Allan]] notes a resemblance to the ''[[Wikipedia:Telchines
column2: Telchines]]'' of Greek mythology, a mythological race of divine craftsmen.<ref>{{HM
